topic.title: Serial bus based devices
topic.p: Serial I/O (SIO) bus based devices plug into the trapezoidal SIO port on the computer. The SIO bus has lower speed than an internal or cartridge-based interface, but supports a wider variety of devices. Multiple devices can be connected to the serial bus by daisy-chaining.
The following serial bus based devices are emulated by Altirra:

Because the SIO bus allows for daisy chaining, conflicts on the SIO bus are rare. Some devices, like the 410 Program Recorder, don't have a daisy chaining port and must be at the end of the chain on real hardware; Altirra allows more than one such device to be attached, but this doesn't pose a problem in emulation.
